publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3507u Colin Fox: Scotland’s Social Housing Provision—That the Parliament recognises that affordable social housing is in short supply across Scotland in both rural and urban areas and welcomes all efforts to ensure that everyone gets the opportunity to live in a decent home fit for the 21st century; welcomes the decision of Midlothian Council, for example, to build 1,000 new council houses; urges all council tenants in Edinburgh to make their views known in the stock transfer referendum scheduled for later this month, and believes that local tenant-led participation is crucial to the effective democratic management of social housing projects all across Scotland.
S2M-3507<> Scotland’s Social Housing Provision (lodged on 2 November 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Carolyn Leckie*, Brian Adam*, Chris Ballance*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-3507<> Colin Fox: Scotland’s Social Housing Provision—That the Parliament recognises that affordable social housing is in short supply across Scotland in both rural and urban areas and welcomes all efforts to ensure that everyone gets the opportunity to live in a decent home fit for the 21st century; welcomes the decision of Midlothian Council, for example, to build 1,000 new council houses; urges all council tenants in Edinburgh to make their views known in the stock transfer referendum scheduled for later this month, and believes that local tenant-led participation is crucial to the effective democratic management of social housing projects all across Scotland. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Carolyn Leckie, Brian Adam, Chris Ballance, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan*, Patrick Harvie*, Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-3507*#* Colin Fox: Scotland’s Social Housing Provision—That the Parliament recognises that affordable social housing is in short supply across Scotland in both rural and urban areas and welcomes all efforts to ensure that everyone gets the opportunity to live in a decent home fit for the 21st century; welcomes the decision of Midlothian Council, for example, to build 1,000 new council houses; urges all council tenants in Edinburgh to make their views known in the stock transfer referendum scheduled for later this month, and believes that local tenant-led participation is crucial to the effective democratic management of social housing projects all across Scotland. Supported by: Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*, Campbell Martin*, Eleanor Scott* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S2M-3507# Scotland’s Social Housing Provision (lodged on 2 November 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*, John Swinburne*, Margo MacDonald*
S2M-3507# Scotland’s Social Housing Provision (lodged on 2 November 2005) Donald Gorrie*

S2M-3507# Colin Fox: Scotland’s Social Housing Provision—That the Parliament recognises that affordable social housing is in short supply across Scotland in both rural and urban areas and welcomes all efforts to ensure that everyone gets the opportunity to live in a decent home fit for the 21st century; welcomes the decision of Midlothian Council, for example, to build 1,000 new council houses; urges all council tenants in Edinburgh to make their views known in the stock transfer referendum scheduled for later this month, and believes that local tenant-led participation is crucial to the effective democratic management of social housing projects all across Scotland. Supported by: Ms Rosemary Byrne, Carolyn Leckie, Brian Adam, Chris Ballance, Ms Sandra White, Tommy Sheridan, Patrick Harvie, Fiona Hyslop, Frances Curran, Rosie Kane, Campbell Martin, Eleanor Scott, Mr Adam Ingram, John Swinburne, Margo MacDonald, Donald Gorrie, Mike Pringle*
